Description: Rectangular wooden outer-coffin of Gua; exterior: recessed and painted Hieroglyphic text and eye-panel; interior: painted text and representations of offerings on walls; painted plan of Underworld on floor; part of head-end wall fragmentary.
Curator's comments: Publications: PM IV: p.187; Harco Willems Chests of Life, 1988, [cat no B2L]; Nicholson and Shaw, Ancient Egyptian Materials and Technology (Cambridge 2000), p. 350; N. Strudwick, Masterpieces of Ancient Egypt, London 2006, pp. 81-3. Hereikhanova, D. 2022. Not only for a King: nms-headdresses on the Objects of the Twelfth to Eighteenth Dynasties, in Miniaci, G. And W. Grajetzki (eds), The World of Middle Kingdom Egypt III, MKS 12, 173-185. London.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
